@IvelRev @PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess @OliverHealdUK @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @NorthHertsDC The fact that only recently have we seen the return of reasonable flow shows how low @AffinityWater lowered the groundwater levels. Irresponsible and unsustainable levels of abstraction. Something needs to done to protect what we now have. @EnvAgency @NorthHertsDC @OliverHealdUK

@Parrog3 @PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess @OliverHealdUK @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @NorthHertsDC An abundance of water now demonstrates how the chalk streams were pre abstraction. tweets.text: Yes almost the moment water levels get to a respectable level we get to see a chalk stream that is until the sewage discharges start. A fleeting glimpse then it's gone. @EnvAgency https://t.co/HNHGAiNBV4

Fantastic job by @ellen_halliday big round of applause.

As Ellen highlights the River Lea is in a shocking state, in reality it has become nothing more than a proxy for every other river in the country. Be warned.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/TzrlFTGT0L

"Creating a better place for people and wildlife" is the strap line on @EnvAgency headed note paper. How does this statement fit with sewage discharges into the @RiverChess  on 89 days over the past 18 months. That is 16% of the time being exceptional, really?????

A number of Flood Alerts and Flood Warnings remain in place across #EastYorkshire this evening. 

With further rain forecast we continue to monitor the situation. 

Keep up to date with the latest and to sign up for free flood warnings visit:

https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

#FloodAware https://t.co/gENkcUua5w

Flood Alerts for the Pont & Blyth and River Skerne are no longer in force.

Our teams continue to monitor the situation closely.

Check your flood risk and stay up to date with the latest situation on https://t.co/uxpMRoGWoh

#FloodAware https://t.co/ufJpQuYytR

tweets.text: We lowered the Hull Tidal Surge Barrier this morning at low tide to help reduce water levels in the #River #Hull. When lowered the 212 tonne steel gate prevents tidal water entering the River Hull, creating additional space to drain water from rivers that flow into the river Hull https://t.co/kZV5Egolky

These hinges form part of the vertical sector gates being installed at the Port of Boston wet dock entrance. The hinges are anchored to the concrete & support the gates as they open & close. #HollandiaInfra will ship the finished gates across to the #BostonBarrier site in May. https://t.co/7aj7BULwQ3

Brilliant afternoon #derbyshirearchaeologyday @DerbyshireArch Looking forward to tomorrow. Special thanks Kris @TPArchaeology & Will @cfa_archaeology for presentation on wooden structure discovered during @EnvAgency scheme to improve fish passage/biodiversity at Dovecliff Weir. https://t.co/usi6wcOC6b
At our Lea Marston depot today with our new starters undertaking pump training to maintain our incident readiness #WinterReady @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/z8LxIYzWWv

@VictoriaMurray3 @YorksWildlife @NewtPartnership @Fr_RowntreePark @northyorkmoors @RyedaleDC @ScarboroCouncil @RaincliffeWoods @YorkCountyParks @DalbyFriends @StNicksFields @EnvAgencyYNE Can't seem to dm you
I have a garden pond in Bishopthorpe near York. 
Saw 2 common newts in it once about 2 years ago 
Don't know if they're still there but would be happy to have have great crested newts if it is suitable

Illegal fishing endangers wildlife and fish stocks.

In East Anglia alone, our officers seized 52 illegal nets and traps between March and December last year.

If you see an illegal net or trap let us know by calling 0800 807060.

More info: https://t.co/LXS1yx3Qnm https://t.co/Rqr8TT3zrz

Do you like Great Crested Newts?! ü¶é do you like ponds and are you in north #yorkshire?  If yes, would you like @YorksWildlife to install #GCN pond habitat in your park, garden or land for FREE?? If you‚Äôre interested please pm new for more details. @NewtPartnership https://t.co/MudCc8PCFS
@SusHeritage @EnvAgency Oh I‚Äôd love to listen to this if it‚Äôs recorded? Embed all the medieval timber fear deeply into my brain!

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/qatD7dFz4V https://t.co/azyMkCKLJA

A groundwater flood alert has been issued for east Kent.

We are working extremely closely with the @EnvAgencySE @Kent_cc and @SouthernWater to tackle any problems that might come our way.

Full update: https://t.co/WmmGJa33p2 https://t.co/To6JzCRZyA

@VictoriaMurray3 @YorksWildlife @NewtPartnership @Fr_RowntreePark @northyorkmoors @RyedaleDC @ScarboroCouncil @RaincliffeWoods @YorkCountyParks @DalbyFriends @StNicksFields @EnvAgencyYNE Possible sites in our area. Please can you DM with criteria - near known GCN site? Naturally wet area?
@PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess Also it‚Äôs plans to build a 300m concrete dam paid for by a 400 acre quarry... not needed, not wanted, better options
@TravelSomerset @EnvAgencySW @SomersetCouncil Thank you very much for the update! AB

@VictoriaMurray3 @YorksWildlife @NewtPartnership @Fr_RowntreePark @northyorkmoors @RyedaleDC @ScarboroCouncil @RaincliffeWoods @YorkCountyParks @DalbyFriends @StNicksFields @EnvAgencyYNE Hi, we have a 3 acre site at Naburn, south of York where we are trying to improve the biodiversity and manage it for nature. We would love to have a pond installed for GCNs. Currently we only have some sunken baths!
